medical_history.chief_complaint: Severe lower abdominal pain and chills.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began 10 days before admission after eating at a restaurant, characterized by nonbloody emesis attributed to food poisoning that persisted for 2 days. One day later, bilateral abdominal pain developed, which waxed and waned. During a 2-day driving trip, the patient experienced watery, nonbloody diarrhea associated with eating. After relocation, chills, fevers, sharp abdominal pain with bloating developed. Pain intensified, rated as 9 to 10 out of 10 on a pain scale.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of a 1-cm ovarian cyst identified during teenage years.
medical_history.family_history: Father had diabetes mellitus, hyperlipidemia, and hypertension; no family history of cancer.
medical_history.social_history: Patient does not smoke or use alcohol or illicit drugs. Never been sexually active.
